fv:BDDef.label: Bridge Domain
comment: A private layer 2 network context that belongs to a specific tenant or context, or is shared.
OptimizeWanBandwidth flag is enabled between sites
OptimizeWanBandwidth.label: Optimize Wan Bandwidth between sites

comment: A property to specify whether ARP flooding is enabled. If flooding is disabled, unicast routing will be performed on the target IP address.
arpFlood.label: ARP Flooding

comment: Outer multicast group IP address.
bcastP.label: bcastP

comment: null
bdDn.label: bdDn

comment: BDStretch flag is enabled between sites
bdStretch.label: BD Stretch between sites flag

comment: Delete or ignore. For internal use only.
childAction.label: childAction

comment: Bitmask representation of the configuration issues found during the endpoint group deployment.
configIssues.label: configIssues

validValues.label: first hop security enabled on layer 2 only bridge domain
igmpsnoop disabled on multicast enabled BD

comment: The private network the endpoint group is associated with.
ctxDefDn.label: ctxDefDn

comment: target not specified, using default
validValues.label: default-target

comment: target not found, using default
validValues.label: mismatch-target

comment: no issue
validValues.label: none

comment: Specifies a description of the policy definition root.
descr.label: Description

comment: A tag or metadata is a non-hierarchical keyword or term assigned to the fabric module.
dn.label: dn

comment:
Represents the parameter used by the node (i.e. Leaf) to
                     clear all EPs in all leaves for this BD.
epClear.label: Clear Endpoints

comment: The End Point move detection option uses the Gratuitous Address Resolution Protocol (GARP). A gratuitous ARP is an ARP broadcast-type of packet that is used to verify that no other device on the network has the same IP address as the sending device.
epMoveDetectMode.label: EP Move Detection Mode

comment: Detection through GARP
validValues.label: GARP based detection

comment: Control whether BUM traffic is allowed between sites
intersiteBumTrafficAllow.label: Allow BUM traffic between sites

comment: l2Stretch flag is enabled between sites
intersiteL2Stretch.label: Allow l2Stretch between sites

comment: Multicast. Flag to indicate if ipv6 multicast is enabled
ipv6McastAllow.label: ipv6 Multicast Allow

comment: whether the bd that this bddef represents has copy service enabled
isCopySvc.label: isCopySvc

comment: A property to indicate whether this object is created for an internal service bridge domain or for a user bridge domain.
isSvc.label: isSvc

comment: A value that indicates how this object was created. For internal use only.
lcOwn.label: lcOwn

comment: Limits IP address learning to the bridge domain subnets only. Every BD can have multiple subnets associated with it. By default, all IPs are learned.
limitIpLearnToSubnets.label: Limit IP learning to BD subnets only

comment: The override of the system generated IPv6 link-local address.
llAddr.label: IPv6 Link Local Address

comment: The MAC address of the bridge domain (BD) or switched virtual interface (SVI).  Every BD by default takes the fabric-wide default MAC address. You can override that address with a different one. By default the BD will take a 00:22:BD:F8:19:FF mac address.
mac.label: MAC Address

comment: rogue mcast ARP packet drop
mcastARPDrop.label: BD rogue mcast ARP packet drop

comment: Multicast. Flag to indicate if multicast is enabled
mcastAllow.label: Multicast Allow

missingContent.label: Missing Content because of Version Mismatch at the time of the push

comment: The time when this object was last modified.
modTs.label: modTs

comment: The monitoring policy attached to this observable object.
monPolDn.label: Monitoring policy

comment: The layer 2 maximum transmit unit (MTU) size.
mtu.label: MTU Size

comment: The multiple destination forwarding method for L2 Multicast, Broadcast, and Link Layer traffic types.
multiDstPktAct.label: Multi Destination Packet Action

comment: BD Flood, flood with all L2 encapsulations in that BD
validValues.label: Flood in BD

comment: Drop
validValues.label: Drop

comment: Flood with the L2 Encapsulation
validValues.label: Flood in Encapsulation

comment: null
name.label: Name

comment: The key for enabling clients to own their data for entity correlation.
ownerKey.label: ownerKey

comment: A tag for enabling clients to add their own data. For example, to indicate who created this object.
ownerTag.label: ownerTag

comment: The default class ID for unknown unicast traffic terminating on this bridge domain.
pcTag.label: pcTag

comment: Identifies an object from its siblings within the context of its parent object. The distinguished name contains a sequence of relative names.
rn.label: rn

comment: A LAN domain segment.
seg.label: seg

comment: The upgrade status. This property is for internal use only.
status.label: status

comment:
In a setter method: specifies that an object should be created. An error is returned if the object already exists.  
In the return value of a setter method: indicates that an object has been created.
validValues.label: created

comment:
In a setter method: specifies that an object should be deleted.  
In the return value of a setter method: indicates that an object has been deleted.
validValues.label: deleted

comment:
In a setter method: specifies that an object should be modified  
In the return value of a setter method: indicates that an object has been modified.
validValues.label: modified

comment: The domain type.
type.label: type

comment: The forwarding method based on predefined forwarding criteria (IP or MAC address).
unicastRoute.label: Unicast Routing

comment: The forwarding method for unknown layer 2 destinations.
unkMacUcastAct.label: Unknown Mac Unicast Action

comment: Default value is proxy
Flooding
validValues.label: Flood

comment: Proxy
validValues.label: Hardware Proxy

comment: The parameter used by the node (i.e. a leaf) for forwarding data for an unknown multicast destination.
unkMcastAct.label: Unknown Multicast Destination Action

comment: Flooding
validValues.label: Flood

comment: Optimized flooding
validValues.label: Optimized Flood

comment: Flooding
validValues.label: Flood

comment: Optimized flooding
validValues.label: Optimized Flood

comment:
Virtual MAC address of the BD/SVI.  This is used
                     when the BD is extended to multiple sites using
                     l2 Outside.
vmac.label: Virtual MAC Address
